choices.answer: Dr. Michael Sherfy

questions.question: Who is this guy?

choices.answer: Thomas Jefferson
George Jefferson
George Washington
John Adams

questions.question: What was the purpose of the Proclamation of 1763?

choices.answer: To establish a permanent boundary line between Indians and colonists
To protect the French fur trade from assaults by colonists or Indians
To identify western lands as formally belonging to the Indians
To prevent colonists from settling west of the Appalachian Mountains

questions.question: Why did England seek to extract more money from the colonists?

choices.answer: King George was displeased with the profits from colonial exports.
King George thought the colonists should help pay England's war debt.
King George's policies were an extension of his aggressive personality.
The King wanted to punish colonists who called for independence.

questions.question: In an effort to generate income for England, in 1764 George Grenville initiated the

choices.answer: Currency Act.
Sugar Act.
Quartering Act.
Proclamation Act.

questions.question: Who is this guy?

choices.answer: Hulk Hogan
Dr. Sherfy's Brother
The guy who shut down Gawker
The guy who wrassled Rocky in that one Rocky movie

questions.question: How did the Stamp Act differ from the Sugar Act?

choices.answer: The Stamp Act was merely a revision of a previously existing tax.
The Stamp Act was a tax that was to be paid mainly by merchants and shipper
The Stamp Act was enforced by British instead of American officials.
The Stamp Act was an internal tax that affected lots of colonists

questions.question: George Grenville claimed that Americans had “virtual representation” because

choices.answer: the colonists were allowed to send delegates to the House of Commons.
the House of Commons represented all British subjects, wherever they were.
each American colony had its own colonial assembly for governance.
the colonists were represented in the Continental Congress.

questions.question: How did the British government respond to the colonial reaction to the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: It affirmed the governing power of the colonists.
It prepared for a long military conflict.
It repealed the Stamp Act in March 1766.
It initiated imperial restructuring.

questions.question: How did the Declaratory Act show Britain's refusal to compromise on Parliament's power to tax?

choices.answer: It asserted Parliament's right to legislate for the colonies.
The Declaratory Act gave more power to the colonial governors.
It initiated a new series of taxes on rarely used colonial goods.
The Act gave colonists authority to legislate for themselves.

questions.question: In 1767, Charles Townshend enacted the Revenue Act, which

choices.answer: levied an internal tax against the colonists.
placed new duties on imported items.
was an innovative form of income tax.
taxed building materials, such as brick and wood.

questions.question: How did the colonists respond to the Townshend duties?

choices.answer: Colonists argued they could not afford to pay the burdensome tax rate.
Colonists resented that part of the revenue would pay royal governors' sala
Colonists did not mind paying the external duties on trade goods.
Colonists cheered that it strengthened legislative government in America

questions.question: The Daughters of Liberty suggested that women participate in public affairs and protest the Townshend duties by

choices.answer: participating in nonconsumption.
growing their own tea plants.
joining men in street protests.
marching on the governor's mansion.

questions.question: What was the Boston Massacre?

choices.answer: A riot that killed two hundred people
A confrontation, which left a customs official dead
A skirmish in which five people were killed
A mutiny aboard British ships carrying tea

questions.question: Why did John Adams represent the British soldiers who were involved in the Boston Massacre

choices.answer: to please loyalist members of his family.
to prove that the colonists had the upper hand.
to sabotage the trial by offering a poor defense for the soldiers.
to show that local leaders supported British liberty and law.

questions.question: What was the result of the anti-British boycotts?

choices.answer: British merchants made more money.
Imports fell by 40 percent.
Anti-British sentiment decreased.
The Sons of Liberty ceased to exist.

questions.question: Lord North removed all the Townsend duties except for the tax on

choices.answer: tea.
glass.
lead.
paper.

questions.question: According to the British, the major purpose of the Tea Act of 1773 was to

choices.answer: break the American boycott of tea imported from England.
raise more revenue to cover military costs in North America.
boost sales for Britain's East India Company.
punish the Americans for importing tea from Holland.

questions.question: Dissenting colonists believed the real goal of the Tea Act of 1773 was to

choices.answer: provoke a conflict with the colonies.
put Dutch tea companies out of business.
demonstrate cooperation on trade.
pay the salaries of royal officials.

questions.question: How many bones are in the human body
The Coercive Acts, passed by Parliament to punish Massachusetts for the Destruction of the Tea, included

choices.answer: a law closing Boston harbor until the tea was paid for.
a new set of high internal and external tax laws.
a law stipulating criminals would be tried in Canada.
the end of spring elections of town selectmen.

questions.question: The Quebec Act offended many Americans because

choices.answer: it denied many political rights to Roman Catholics.
it permitted criminal cases to be adjudicated without the use of juries.
it gave French Canadians unrestricted entry into New England.
it gave Roman Catholic Quebec control of the Ohio Valley.

questions.question: Why did the Coercive Acts spread alarm among the colonists?

choices.answer: They feared their liberties were insecure.
Tea prices were bound to increase
They would no longer be able to import goods.
Colonists knew a war for independence was coming.

questions.question: Which colony failed to send a delegate to the First Continental Congress in Philadelphia?

choices.answer: Rhode Island
New Jersey
Georgia
Pennsylvania
